alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 7:39PM CDT until May 19 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Fort Bend, Wharton and Austin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 18.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 19.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage late Thursday night or early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 05/10/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 18.8 Tue 7 pm CDT 19.1 17.5 16.6 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 145 PM CDT.
